ovdesc.p: The parameter table for Multi Tenant Administration processing.
This parameter table specifies the message emit type, by which the message(xml) formation can be configured as INDIVIDUAL messages(multiple emit).
The table can also control the style of the message(s) that are generated and which OFS source is used to process the emitted message(s).
1. OPERATION.MODE = EXECUTE will emit messages (xml) according to the setup in this parameter table.
2. OPERATION.MODE = MAINTAIN will not emit any.
3. When there is no PARAM.ID defined in console table, system will take DEFAULT parameter record released as part of MT module.

4. When there is no PARAM.ID and also no entry in parameter table (no live record, may be in unauthorized stage), the default message settings used are: message emit type = INDIVIDUAL, message type = QUEUE and OFS.SOURCE=TENANT.PROCESS.
5. Each message will contain the tenant id which can be used by an ESB (or other messaging systems) to route messages to the respective tenants.
6. With the QUEUE based message production an OFS payload (for use with the external system) will have a prefix of the tenant id and be embedded in the emitted XML message.
7. With the TOPIC based message production an OFS payload (for use with the external system) will have a prefix of the topic and the tenant id and be embedded in the emitted XML message.

desc.p: Unique reference to identify the parameter table for MT Admin console process.
Validation Rules:
Maximum of 35 alphanumeric characters allowed
Specifies the description/nature of usage of the parameter record for the MT Admin Console process.
Validation Rules:
This field is to define the message emission type, by which the message(xml) formation can be defined as INDIVIDUAL messages(multi emit) during MT console table authorisation.
Validation Rules:

p.p: INDIVIDUAL :- One event emit will happen for each tenant.
If the SERVICE.COMP.MNE field in MT.TSA.SERVICE.CONSOLE has more than one value, then several event messages will be created in the single xml emitted.

desc.p: This field contains the style of the message(s) to be generated.
Validation Rules:

p.p: 1. QUEUE :- Signifies that the message should contain an embedded OFS payload, that can be passed through with minimal intervention from the external tools. A QUEUE based message will have tenant id as the prefix to the OFS payload. The emitted message is still XML format.

2. TOPIC :- Signifies that the message should contain an embedded OFS payload, that can be passed through with minimal intervention from the external tools. A TOPIC based message will have both the topic and the tenant id as the prefix to the OFS payload. The emitted message is still XML format.
This TOPIC prefix value will be considered as a target directory/queue in an external system where the messages can be placed for further processing.

desc.p: This field can have the topic prefix value for the topic message type defined in MSG.TYPE field.
This value will be prefixed to the ofs payload (along with tenant id) which will be part of the output xml.

Maximum of 35 characters allowed
Value permitted only when MSG.TYPE = TOPIC.
This field is mandatory if MSG.TYPE = TOPIC.
